verses.plain: So I returned, and considered all the oppressions that are done under the sun: and behold the tears of such as were oppressed, and they had no comforter; and on the side of their oppressors there was power; but they had no comforter.

tokens.t: So I returned, and considered all the oppressions that are done under the sun: and behold the tears of
oppressed, and they had no comforter; and on the side of their oppressors
power; but they had no comforter.

verses.plain: Wherefore I praised the dead which are already dead more than the living which are yet alive.

tokens.t: Wherefore I praised the dead which are already dead more than the living which are yet alive.

verses.plain: Yea, better is he than both they, which hath not yet been, who hath not seen the evil work that is done under the sun.

tokens.t: Yea, better
than both they, which hath not yet been, who hath not seen the evil work that is done under the sun.

verses.plain: ¶ Again, I considered all travail, and every right work, that for this a man is envied of his neighbour. This is also vanity and vexation of spirit.

tokens.t: ¶ Again, I considered all travail, and every right work, that for this a man is envied of his neighbour. This
also vanity and vexation of spirit.

verses.plain: The fool foldeth his hands together, and eateth his own flesh.

tokens.t: The fool foldeth his hands together, and eateth his own flesh.

verses.plain: Better is an handful with quietness, than both the hands full with travail and vexation of spirit.

tokens.t: Better
an handful
quietness, than both the hands full
travail and vexation of spirit.

verses.plain: ¶ Then I returned, and I saw vanity under the sun.

tokens.t: ¶ Then I returned, and I saw vanity under the sun.

verses.plain: There is one alone, and there is not a second; yea, he hath neither child nor brother: yet is there no end of all his labour; neither is his eye satisfied with riches; neither saith he, For whom do I labour, and bereave my soul of good? This is also vanity, yea, it is a sore travail.

tokens.t: There is one
, and
not a second; yea, he hath neither child nor brother: yet
no end of all his labour; neither is his eye satisfied with riches; neither
, For whom do I labour, and bereave my soul of good? This
also vanity, yea, it
a sore travail.

verses.plain: ¶ Two are better than one; because they have a good reward for their labour.

tokens.t: ¶ Two
better than one; because they have a good reward for their labour.

verses.plain: For if they fall, the one will lift up his fellow: but woe to him that is alone when he falleth; for he hath not another to help him up.

tokens.t: For if they fall, the one will lift up his fellow: but woe to him
alone when he falleth; for
not another to help him up.

verses.plain: Again, if two lie together, then they have heat: but how can one be warm alone?

tokens.t: Again, if two lie together, then they have heat: but how can one be warm

verses.plain: And if one prevail against him, two shall withstand him; and a threefold cord is not quickly broken.

tokens.t: And if one prevail against him, two shall withstand him; and a threefold cord is not quickly broken.

verses.plain: ¶ Better is a poor and a wise child than an old and foolish king, who will no more be admonished.

tokens.t: ¶ Better
a poor and a wise child than an old and foolish king, who will no more be admonished.

verses.plain: For out of prison he cometh to reign; whereas also he that is born in his kingdom becometh poor.

tokens.t: For out of prison he cometh to reign; whereas also
born in his kingdom becometh poor.

verses.plain: I considered all the living which walk under the sun, with the second child that shall stand up in his stead.

tokens.t: I considered all the living which walk under the sun, with the second child that shall stand up in his stead.

verses.plain: There is no end of all the people, even of all that have been before them: they also that come after shall not rejoice in him. Surely this also is vanity and vexation of spirit.

tokens.t: no end of all the people,
of all that have been before them: they also that come after shall not rejoice in him. Surely this also
vanity and vexation of spirit.

footnotes.text: every…: Heb. all the rightness of work
for this…: Heb. this is the envy of a man from his neighbour
who…: Heb. who knoweth not to be admonished
